lexUnit.name: rucksack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: .a bag with two shoulder straps which allow it to be carried on the back, used by hikers.

sentence.text: In the rucksack in which she seemed to keep half her life she burrowed and came up with a biro and writing-pad .
Too windy , they said , dumping five rucksacks of supplies in the snow , well below Base Camp Three , at 24,500ft .
Davis checked that each man had a rucksack of bombs , a pocketful of fuses , benzedrine tablets , a full water-bottle and a loaded weapon .
I placed my pipes and rucksack on the back seat of the jeep and informed the driver that I was going into the orchard for a last look round .
With rucksacks on their shoulders and clutching their weapons , the group of desperadoes trudged up the main coast road , clearly silhouetted by the headlamps of passing enemy traffic .
He wears a brown rucksack on his back .
Placing the bagpipes in my rucksack I made my way back across the green to the orchard , expecting a summons at any moment to appear before Shimi Lovat .
Safety pundits will be pleased to note that I received my just desserts that evening , on unpacking my rucksack and discovering that the action had mashed a forgotten egg sandwich into my hat .
He puts his thumbs between the shoulder straps of his rucksack and his jacket and sticks his chest and chin out .
Cornelius unzipped his rucksack .
They wrestled , grunting , Ross hampered by the rucksack .
Broadly speaking there are three types -- daysacks , weekend sacks and backpacking rucksacks .
I had a look at the bagpipes before pulling the rucksack onto my back , they seemed to be all right -- wonder when I 'll play them again ?
I looked smugly at my heavy rucksack with its bedding , iron rations , matches , camera , thick woolly , good torch , spare batteries , toothbrush , towel and soap .
He stuffs everything back in the rucksack for the third time .
We were all hungry , so began to search our rucksacks for food which did not require to be cooked .
Andy throws the man 's rucksack into the shaft , then bends and takes the man under one armpit , trying to heave him up .
There were Poles returning home after selling rucksacks full of sausages , butter , Polish vodka and cigarettes on West Berlin 's black market .
A sense of humour and a small soft rucksack or carry bag to hold all this paraphernalia are useful .
Carrying a rucksack or anything over your shoulder is likely to aggravate this .
He was carrying a small rucksack by one of its straps .
The following Monday Peter packed his rucksack and caught the train to Ipswich .
I packed my rucksack , signed the visitors ' book , left my list of sightings in the common room and said my farewells .
Welcome back : Thousands of teenagers will be packing their rucksacks to travel around the world this summer , and get away from the stress of exams .
